sen.j: 堂上家（とうしょうけ、どうじょうけ）とは、日本の歴史上、清涼殿南廂にある殿上間に昇殿出来る資格が世襲された公家の家。
sen.e: Toshoke, in the history of Japan, means family of court noble which was hereditary qualified to be admitted to Tenjo no Ma chamber which was located under the eaves on the south side of the Seiryo- den.
Toshoke, in the history of Japan, means family of court nobles hereditary qualified to be admitted to Tenjo no Ma chamber located under the eaves on the south side of the Seiryo- den.

Toshoke, also referred to as Dojoke, in the history of Japan, means family of court nobles hereditary qualified to be admitted to Tenjo no Ma chamber located under the eaves on the south side of the Seiryoden (Literally "Limpid Cool Hall," an imperial summer palace)
sen.cmt: 削除した dojoke をここに入れました。dojoke→Dojoke清涼殿の定訳

sen.j: 地下家を除く公家をさす。
sen.e: It represents court nobles other than jige-ke (family status of non-noble retainers who are not allowed into the Emperor's living quarters in the imperial palace)
It represents court nobles other than jige-ke (family status of non-noble retainers who are not allowed into the Emperor's living quarters in the imperial palace)
It represents court nobles other than jigeke (family status of non-noble retainers who are not allowed into the Emperor's living quarters in the imperial palace).

sen.j: 江戸時代末に137家あった。
sen.e: There were 137 families at the end of the Edo Period
There were 137 families at the end of the Edo Period
There were 137 families at the end of the Edo Period.

sen.j: 平安時代中期に昇殿の制が始まったことと、公卿となることが出来る家柄が院政期から固定されるようになったことに伴い、公家の中で昇殿を許される家柄である堂上家と許されない地下家（じげけ）の区分が成立した。
sen.e: As, in the middle of the Heian Period, the system of shoden (to enter the court) was commenced and the family lineage which can become kugyo (court noble) were fixed since the insei period (during the period of the government by the retired Emperor), discrimination among kuge (court nobles) between toshoke for which shoden was allowed and jigeke for which shoden was not allowed was established.

As, in the middle of the Heian Period, the system of shoden (to enter the court) commenced and the family lineage that can become kugyo (court nobility) were fixed since the insei period (during the period of the government by a retired Emperor), discrimination among kuge (court nobles) between toshoke for which shoden was allowed and jigeke for which shoden was not allowed was established.

As, in the middle of the Heian Period, the system of shoden (to enter the court) commenced and the family lineage that can become kugyo (court nobility) were fixed since the insei period (during the period of the government by a retired Emperor), discrimination among kuge (court nobles) between toshoke for which shoden was allowed and jigeke for which shoden was not allowed was established.

sen.j: 一般的に公卿となると昇殿が許されるが、希に地下の公卿も存在した。
sen.e: Generally, if one becomes kugyo, shoden was allowed but, in rare cases, kugyo which was jige (not allowed to shoden) existed.
Generally, if one becomes kugyo, shoden was allowed but, in rare cases, kugyo which was jige (shoden not allowed) existed.
Generally, if one becomes kugyo, shoden was allowed but, in rare cases, kugyo which was jige (shoden not allowed) existed.

sen.j: 広義では公卿になることが出来る摂家、清華家、大臣家、羽林家、名家 (公家)、半家 (公家)の総称である。
sen.e: In a broad sense, it was a generic name of sekke, seigake, daijinke, urinke, meike (kuge) and hanke (kuge) which were eligible to become kugyo.
In a broad sense, it was a generic name of sekke, seigake, daijinke, urinke, meike (kuge), and hanke (kuge) that were eligible to become kugyo.
In a broad sense, it was a generic name of sekke, seigake, daijinke, urinke, meike (kuge), and hanke (kuge) that were eligible to become kugyo.

sen.j: 狭義では上記の内、羽林家以下を指し、平堂上とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: In a narrow sense, it denoted urinke or lower among them and it was also called hiratosho.
In a narrow sense, it denoted urinke or lower ranks among them and it was also called hiratosho.
In a narrow sense, it denoted urinke or lower ranks among them and it was also called hiratosho.

sen.j: 南北朝期以降堂上家のなかに、時の天皇との親疎により内々・外様の区別が出来た。
sen.e: Since the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, discrimination between "nainai" and "tozama" was created by closeness to the then current emperor Northern and Southern Dynasties period
sen.cmt: 「内々」の正しい読みは不明です。
sen.e: Since the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, discrimination between "nainai" and "tozama" was created according to the closeness to the then current emperor of the Northern and Southern Dynasties period
Since the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, discrimination between "nainai" and "tozama" was created according to the closeness to the then current emperor.
sen.cmt: of the Northern and Southern Dynasties period 削除。

sen.j: 出勤した時の御所内の詰め所も異なり、天皇の待遇も違った。
sen.e: Tsumesho (station) in the Imperial Palace when attended the office were different and the treatment by the emperor was also different.
Tsumesho (station) in the Imperial Palace when attended the office were different and treatment from the emperor was also different.
Tsumesho (station) in the Imperial Palace when attended the office were different and treatment from the emperor was also different.

sen.j: また、安土桃山時代の天正年間（1573-1591）迄に成立していた65家を旧家、それ以降新規に設立された家を新家と区分している。
sen.e: It was also classified to sixty-five kyuke (literally, old family) whch had been formed by Tensho era (1573-1591) in the Azuchi-Momoyama Period and shinke (literally, new family) which was established after that.

It was also classified in sixty-five kyuke (literally, old families) whch had been formed during the Tensho era (1573-1591), during the Azuchi-Momoyama Period, and shinke (literally, new family) which was established after that.

It was also classified in 65 kyuke (literally, old families) whch had been formed by the Tensho era (1573-1591), during the Azuchi-Momoyama Period, and shinke (literally, new family) which was established after that.
sen.cmt: 数字表記変更「during」the Tensho era →「by」（までになので）

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年）7月7日平堂上のうち、大納言まで宣任の例が多い家が伯爵に、それ以外は子爵に叙せられた。
sen.e: On July 7, 1884, among hiradojo, families from which many were promoted to Dainagon (Major Counselor) were appointed to count and others were to viscount.
On July 7, 1884, among hiradojo, families from which many were promoted to Dainagon (Major Counselor) were appointed to count and others to viscount.
On July 7, 1884, among hiradojo, families from which many were promoted to Dainagon (Chief councilor of state) were appointed to count and others to viscount.

sen.j: ※文久3（1863年）年版『雲上明覧』による
sen.e: * According to "Unjo meiran (books giving a detailed view of the Imperial family and Court nobles)," 1863 version,
* According to "Unjo meiran (books giving a detailed view of the Imperial family and Court nobles)," 1863 version,
* According to "Unjo meiran" (books giving a detailed view of the Imperial family and Court nobles), 1863 version
sen.cmt: 書名部分にのみ "" を付けました。文末のカンマ削除しました。
